places.name: Rara Lake
places.description: Nepal's largest freshwater lake nestled in the Himalayas at 2,990m altitude.
places.detail: Located in Rara National Park, this stunning blue lake measures 5.1 sq km with depths reaching 167m. Surrounded by pine forests and snow peaks, it's often called 'Heaven on Earth' for its pristine beauty.

details.subtitle: Discovery
details.text: First documented by British surveyor Jimmy Roberts in 1933

details.subtitle: Protected Status
details.text: Rara National Park established in 1976 to conserve the ecosystem

details.subtitle: Tourism Potential
details.text: Developing as an eco-tourism destination with strict visitor limits

details.subtitle: Scientific Importance
details.text: Critical habitat for endangered species like red panda and musk deer

travelTips: Carry all supplies - no shops nearby

places.name: Shey Phoksundo Lake
places.description: Deep turquoise alpine lake in Dolpo region at 3,611m elevation.
places.detail: This spectacular lake in Shey Phoksundo National Park has no aquatic life due to high mineral content. The surrounding area features ancient Bon monasteries and traditional Tibetan-style villages.

details.subtitle: Sacred Site
details.text: Considered holy in pre-Buddhist Bon religion for millennia

details.subtitle: First Western Visit
details.text: Documented by British explorer John Hunt in 1953

details.subtitle: Conservation Area
details.text: Core zone of Nepal's largest national park (3,555 sq km)

details.subtitle: Cultural Preservation
details.text: Protects unique Bon-Po Buddhist syncretic traditions

places.name: Sinja Valley
places.description: Ancient capital of the Khas Malla kingdom (12th-14th century).
places.detail: This archaeological treasure in Jumla district was the center where the Nepali language originated. The valley contains ruins of palaces, temples, and the oldest Nepali manuscript (the 'Uttaradhayana Sutra').

details.subtitle: Language Birthplace
details.text: Where proto-Nepali (Khas Kura) evolved into modern Nepali

details.subtitle: UNESCO Recognition
details.text: Tentative World Heritage Site since 2008

details.subtitle: Cultural Heritage
details.text: Preserves medieval Nepali architecture and inscriptions

details.subtitle: Research Site
details.text: Important for studying Nepali language development

travelTips: Hire local guide for historical context

places.name: Dolpo Region
places.description: Remote Himalayan district preserving Tibetan culture and ancient trade routes.
places.detail: One of Nepal's most isolated areas, Upper Dolpo was closed to foreigners until 1989. The region features medieval villages, salt trade caravans, and stunning landscapes featured in the film 'Himalaya'.

details.subtitle: Ancient Trade
details.text: Part of Tibet-Nepal salt and wool exchange for centuries

details.subtitle: Cultural Isolation
details.text: Preserved 11th-century Tibetan Buddhist traditions

details.subtitle: Restricted Access
details.text: Requires special permit to protect fragile culture

details.subtitle: Adventure Tourism
details.text: Popular for challenging treks like Dolpo to Mustang

places.name: Khaptad National Park
places.description: Sacred mid-mountain park blending biodiversity and spiritual sites.
places.detail: This 225 sq km park ranges from 1,400m to 3,300m with grasslands, forests, and Himalayan views. The area is associated with Khaptad Baba, a revered Hindu saint who meditated here for 50 years.

details.subtitle: Spiritual Heritage
details.text: Khaptad Baba established ashram here in 1940s

details.subtitle: Park Establishment
details.text: Created in 1984 to protect unique ecosystem

details.subtitle: Biodiversity
details.text: Home to 266 bird species and 23 mammal species

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Site
details.text: Attracts Hindu devotees to Khaptad Baba's ashram

travelTips: No alcohol/non-veg food in sacred areas
Hire local guides for best trails

places.name: Bardibas-Thori Eco-Trail
places.description: Emerging wildlife corridor connecting Chitwan and Parsa National Parks.
places.detail: This 60km trail through Mahottari district offers jungle walks, Tharu culture, and growing wildlife sightings including tigers and elephants moving between protected areas.

details.subtitle: Ancient Route
details.text: Part of historic trade path between hills and Terai

details.subtitle: Rewilding Project
details.text: Active corridor restoration since 2010

details.subtitle: Conservation
details.text: Critical for genetic diversity of Terai wildlife

details.subtitle: Community Tourism
details.text: Developing homestays and guided walks

places.name: Tilicho Lake
places.description: One of the world's highest lakes at 4,919m in Annapurna Conservation Area.
places.detail: Though primarily in Gandaki Province, this stunning glacial lake is accessible from Manang district in Karnali. The turquoise waters are surrounded by Annapurna massif peaks.

details.subtitle: First Survey
details.text: Mapped by British explorer Tilman in 1950

details.subtitle: Sacred Status
details.text: Considered holy by both Hindus and Buddhists

details.subtitle: Trekking Destination
details.text: Popular side trip on Annapurna Circuit

details.subtitle: Climate Research
details.text: Monitored for glacial retreat impacts

places.name: Surkhet Valley
places.description: Emerging adventure hub in mid-western Nepal's 'Green Valley'.
places.detail: The capital of Karnali Province offers hot springs, caves, and trekking routes to Rara and Dolpo. The valley is known for organic farming and emerging eco-tourism projects.

details.subtitle: Ancient Trade Center
details.text: Connected Himalayan and Terai regions for centuries

details.subtitle: Development
details.text: Rapid growth since becoming provincial capital

details.subtitle: Transport Hub
details.text: Gateway to remote Karnali destinations

details.subtitle: Sustainable Agriculture
details.text: Model for organic farming in Nepal

travelTips: Use as acclimatization stop for Rara

places.name: Mugu District
places.description: Remote Himalayan region bordering Tibet with dramatic landscapes.
places.detail: Home to Rara Lake, Mugu features high mountain passes, Tibetan-influenced culture, and Nepal's most isolated villages. The area remains largely undeveloped for tourism.

details.subtitle: Ancient Kingdom
details.text: Part of medieval Khasa Malla empire

details.subtitle: Trade Isolation
details.text: Historically dependent on salt trade with Tibet

details.subtitle: Border Security
details.text: Strategic location near China border

details.subtitle: Development Challenges
details.text: One of Nepal's least developed regions

places.name: Jumla District
places.description: Historic highland region known for apple orchards and ancient manuscripts.
places.detail: The 'Apple Capital of Nepal' sits at 2,540m with medieval villages, alpine pastures, and the origin point of the Nepali language. Jumla produces 90% of Nepal's apples.

details.subtitle: Language Origin
details.text: Where Nepali language first developed from Khas speech

details.subtitle: Agricultural Innovation
details.text: First apple orchards planted in 1960s

details.subtitle: Horticulture
details.text: Center for high-altitude fruit research

details.subtitle: Cultural Tourism
details.text: Base for Rara Lake and Sinja Valley treks
